result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery M. Devlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $443 costs--DOC collect through extended supervision in 13CF2338.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffery M. Devlin in court in custody with attorney Robert D Junig, Jr..  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 9 months Rock Co Jail, concurrent with 13CF1595, 13CF2338 and 13CM1408; 95 days sentence credit; DOC collect $443 costs during extended supervision in 13CF2338.

Defendant Jeffery M. Devlin in court in custody with attorney Robert D Junig, Jr..  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeffery M. Devlin in court in custody with attorney Robert D Junig, Jr..  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffery M. Devlin in court in custody with attorney Robert D Junig, Jr..  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffery M. Devlin in court in custody with attorney Valerie A. Zisman.  Gwanny J. Tjoa and intern Christa Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  May argue bond at next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2015, at 3:00 pm.
